metadata.description: Exercise metadata and configuration for Story Point Master

exercises.title: Abstract Comparisons
exercises.description: Learn relative sizing with abstract items
exercises.details: Start with simple abstract concepts to understand relative effort without real-world bias.

startScreen.instructions: You'll be presented with abstract items like "a grain of sand," "a pebble," "a boulder," and "a mountain." Your task is to arrange them by relative effort to move, then assign story points.

ui.mindsetReminder: Remember: Story points are about relative effort, not absolute time. A '3' is roughly three times the effort of a '1'.

exercises.title: User Stories
exercises.description: Apply sizing to real user stories
exercises.details: Practice with realistic user stories from a typical web application development scenario.

startScreen.instructions: You'll work with realistic user stories from a typical web application. First arrange them by relative complexity, then assign story points (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13) based on complexity, effort, and uncertainty.

exercises.title: Core Principles
exercises.details: Test your knowledge with an interactive quiz covering fundamental story point principles.

startScreen.instructions: Complete an interactive quiz covering the fundamental principles of story point estimation, then review a comprehensive summary of everything you've learned.

preview.title: What You'll Cover:
items: ✓ The three factors: complexity, effort, uncertainty
